paper.title: Hardness of approximating the closest vector problem with pre-processing

author.org: (Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton, NJ, USA
School of Computer Science and Engineering, The Hebrew University of Jerusalem, Jerusalem, Israel#TAB#

paper.abstract: We show that, unless NP/spl sube/DTIME(2/sup poly log(n)/) the closest vector problem with pre-processing, for /spl lscr//sub p/ norm for any p /spl ges/ 1, is hard to approximate within a factor of (log n)/sup 1/p - /spl epsi//u0027 /P for any /spl epsi/ u003e 0. This improves the previous best factor of 3/sup 1/p/ - /spl epsi/ due to Regev (2004). Our results also imply that under the same complexity assumption, the nearest codeword problem with pre-processing is hard to approximate within a factor of (log n)/sup 1 - /spl epsi//u0027 for any /spl epsi/ u003e 0.
